quote0.quote: Time is a sort of river of passing events, and strong is its current; no sooner is a thing brought to sight than it is swept by and another takes its place, and this too will be swept away.
quote0.author: Marcus Aurelius

quote1.quote: For a man can lose neither the past nor the future; for how can one take from him that which is not his? So remember these two points: first, that each thing is of like form from everlasting and comes round again in its cycle, and that it signifies not whether a man shall look upon the same things for a hundred years or two hundred, or for an infinity of time; second, that the longest lived and the shortest lived man, when they come to die, lose one and the same thing.
quote1.author: Marcus AureliusMeditations

quote2.quote: The best way to pay for a lovely moment is to enjoy it.
quote2.author: Richard Bach

quote3.quote: To choose time is to save time.
quote3.author: Francis Bacon

quote4.quote: Time is a dressmaker specializing in alterations.
quote4.author: Faith Baldwin

quote5.quote: The geometry of landscape and situation seems to create its own systems of time, the sense of a dynamic element which is cinematizing the events of the canvas, translating a posture or ceremony into dynamic terms. The greatest movie of the 20th century is the Mona Lisa, just as the greatest novel is Gray's Anatomy.
quote5.author: J. G. Ballard

quote7.quote: We are weighed down, every moment, by the conception and the sensation of Time. And there are but two means of escaping and forgetting this nightmare: pleasure and work. Pleasure consumes us. Work strengthens us. Let us choose.
quote7.author: Charles Baudelaire

quote8.quote: A grindstone that had not grit in it, how long would it take to sharpen an ax? And affairs that had not grit in them, how long would they take to make a man?
quote8.author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote9.quote: The first hour of the morning is the rudder of the day.
quote9.author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote10.quote: The supply of time is a daily miracle. You wake up in the morning and lo! Your purse is magnificently filled with 24 hours of the unmanufactured tissue of the universe of life. It is yours! The most precious of your possessions.
quote10.author: Arnold Bennett

quote11.quote: You wake up in the morning, and your purse is magically filled with twenty-four hours of un-manufactured tissue of the universe of your life! It is yours. It is the most precious of possessions. No one can take it from you. And no one receives either more or less than you receive.
quote11.author: Arnold Bennett

quote12.quote: We never shall have any more time we have, and we have always had, all the time there is.
quote12.author: Thomas A. Bennett

quote13.quote: Modern thought has transferred the spectral character of Death to the notion of time itself. Time has become Death triumphant over all.
quote13.author: John Berger

quote14.quote: There's never enough time to do it right, but there's always enough time to do it over.
quote14.author: Jack Bergman

quote15.quote: Time is a great teacher, but unfortunately it kills all its pupils.
quote15.author: Hector Louis Berlioz

quote16.quote: There is a time for everything, and a season for every activity under heaven. Ecclesiastes 3:1
quote16.author: Bible

quote17.quote: Time is like money, the less we have of it to spare the further we make it go.
quote17.author: Josh Billings

quote18.quote: It is difficult to live in the present, ridiculous to live in the future, and impossible to live in the past. Nothing is as far away as one minute ago.
quote18.author: Jim Bishop, "comment in the NY Journal-American", May 7, 1961

quote19.quote: You will never find time for anything. If you want time, you must make it.
quote19.author: Charles Bixton

quote20.quote: Eternity is in love with the productions of time.
quote20.author: William Blake

quote21.quote: To see the world in a grain of sand, and to see heaven in a wild flower, hold infinity in the palm of your hand, and eternity in an hour.
quote21.author: William Blake

quote22.quote: The hours of folly are measured by the clock, but of wisdom no clock can measure.
quote22.author: William Blake

quote23.quote: A man must be master of his hours and days, not their servant.
quote23.author: William Frederick Book

quote24.quote: I am definitely going to take a course on time management... just as soon as I can work it into my schedule.
quote24.author: Louis E. Boone

quote25.quote: Time is Too slow for those who wait, Too swift for those who fear, Too long for those who grieve, Too short for those who rejoice. But for those who love, time is not.
quote25.author: Henry Van Dyke

quote26.quote: You are not born for fame if you don't know the value of time.
quote26.author: Marquis De Vauvenargues

quote27.quote: Time bears away all things, even the mind.
quote27.author: VirgilEclogues, Book IX, Line 51.

quote28.quote: Time is an equal opportunity employer. Each human being has exactly the same number of hours and minutes every day. Rich people can't buy more hours. Scientists can't invent new minutes. And you can't save time to spend it on another day. Even so, time is amazingly fair and forgiving. No matter how much time you've wasted in the past, you still have an entire tomorrow.
quote28.author: Denis Waitley

quote29.quote: Time is the most precious element of human existence. The successful person knows how to put energy into time and how to draw success from time.
quote29.author: Denis Waitley

quote30.quote: People who cannot find time for recreation are obliged sooner or later to find time for illness.
quote30.author: John Wanamaker

quote31.quote: Time I have only just a minute. Only sixty seconds in it. Forced upon me, can't refuse it. Didn't seek it, didn't choose it. But it's up to me to use it. I must suffer if I lose it. Give account if I abuse it, Just a tiny little minute but eternity is in it.
quote31.author: Christine Warren

quote32.quote: I want to go ahead of Father Time with a scythe of my own.
quote32.author: H. G. [Herbert George] Wells

quote33.quote: Between too early and too late, there is never more than a moment.
quote33.author: Franz Werfel

quote34.quote: Here or henceforward it is all the same to me, I accept Time absolutely.
quote34.author: Walt Whitman

quote36.quote: It is only in appearance that time is a river. It is rather a vast landscape and it is the eye of the beholder that moves.
quote36.author: Thornton WilderThe Eighth Day Harper & Row 67

quote37.quote: For time is the longest distance between two places.
quote37.author: Tennessee (Thomas Lanier) Williams

quote38.quote: In politics a week is a very long time.
quote38.author: Harold Wilson

quote39.quote: We are always acting on what has just finished happening. It happened at least 1/30th of a second ago. We think we're in the present, but we aren't. The present we know is only a movie of the past.
quote39.author: Thomas Wolfe

quote40.quote: Here is the same clock that walked quietly Through those enormous years I half recall,When between one blue summer and anotherTime seemed as many miles as round the world,And world a day, a moment or a mile,Or a sweet slope of grass edged with the sea,Or a new song to sing, or a tree dressed in gold
quote40.author: Judith WrightThe Moving Image, 1946

quote41.quote: There is surely nothing other than the single purpose of the present moment. A man's whole life is a succession of moment after moment. If one fully understands the present moment, there will be nothing else to do, and nothing else to pursue.
quote41.author: Yamamoto TsunetomoHagakure

quote42.quote: The years like great black oxen tread the world, and God the herdsman treads them on behind, and I am broken by their passing feet.
quote42.author: William Butler Yeats

quote43.quote: Procrastination is the thief of time.note: this line also appears in Charles Dickens' David Copperfield.
quote43.author: Edward YoungNight Thoughts. (in Night i. Line 393), 1742

quote44.quote: Without music to decorate it, time is just a bunch of boring production deadlines or dates by which bills must be paid.
quote44.author: Frank Zappa

quote45.quote: The greatest loss of time is delay and expectation, which depend upon the future. We let go the present, which we have in our power, and look forward to that which depends upon chance, and so relinquish a certainty for an uncertainty.
quote45.author: Seneca (Seneca the Elder)

quote46.quote: My pipe is out, my glass is dry;My fire is almost ashes too;But once again, before you go,And I prepare to meet the New;Old Year! a parting word that's true,For we've been comrades, you and I--I thank God for each day of you;There! bless you now! Old Year, good-bye!
quote46.author: Robert William ServiceThe Passing of the Year

quote47.quote: Ha, ha! keep time: how sour sweet music is, When time is broke and no proportion kept!So is it in the music of men's lives.And here have I the daintiness of earTo cheque time broke in a disorder'd string;But for the concord of my state and timeHad not an ear to hear my true time broke.I wasted time, and now doth time waste me;For now hath time made me his numbering clock:My thoughts are minutes; and with sighs they jarTheir watches on unto mine eyes, the outward watch,Whereto my finger, like a dial's point,Is pointing still, in cleansing them from tears.http://www.online-literature.com/shakespeare/richardII/19/
quote47.author: William ShakespeareKing Richard II Act V Scene V

quote48.quote: O, call back yesterday, bid time return.
quote48.author: William Shakespeare

quote50.quote: Everything happens to everybody sooner or later if there is time enough.
quote50.author: George Bernard Shaw

quote51.quote: When the time is right, you just got to do it.
quote51.author: Jack Simplot

quote52.quote: Lost wealth may be replaced by industry, lost knowledge by study, lost health by temperance or medicine, but lost time is gone forever.
quote52.author: Samuel Smiles

quote53.quote: Time: that which man is always trying to kill, ends in killing him.
quote53.author: Herbert Spencer

quote54.quote: Time is the only critic without ambition.
quote54.author: John Steinbeck

quote55.quote: Come on, Come on, and there'll be no turning back. You were only killing time and it can kill you right back Come on, Come on, its time to burn up the fuse. You got nothing to do and even less to lose.
quote55.author: Jim Steinman

quote56.quote: Eternity is a terrible thought. I mean, where's it going to end?
quote56.author: Tom Stoppard

quote57.quote: The longest day must have its close --the gloomiest night will wear on to a morning. An eternal, inexorable lapse of moments is ever hurrying the day of the evil to an eternal night, and the night of the just to an eternal day.
quote57.author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

quote58.quote: Don't serve time, make time serve you
quote58.author: William Sutton

quote59.quote: Time turns the old days to derision, our loves into corpses or wives; and marriage and death and division make barren our lives.
quote59.author: Algernon Charles Swinburne

quote60.quote: The butterfly counts not months but moments, and has time enough.
quote60.author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote61.quote: Time is not a line, but a series of now-points.
quote61.author: Taisen Deshimaru

quote62.quote: If, before going to bed every night, you will tear a page from the calendar, and remark, there goes another day of my life, never to return, you will become time conscious.
quote62.author: A. B. Zu Tavern

quote63.quote: Time will take your money, but money won't buy time.
quote63.author: James Taylor

quote64.quote: A day may sink or save a realm.
quote64.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote65.quote: In eternity there is indeed something true and sublime. But all these times and places and occasions are now and here. God himself culminates in the present moment and will never be more divine in the lapse of the ages. Time is but a stream I go a-fishing in. I drink at it, but when I drink I see the sandy bottom and detect how shallow it is. Its thin current slides away but eternity remains.
quote65.author: Henry David Thoreau

quote66.quote: Time is but the stream I go fishing in. I drink at it, but while I drink I see the sandy bottom and detect how shallow it is. It's thin current slides away, but eternity remains.
quote66.author: Henry David Thoreau

quote67.quote: As if you could kill time without injuring eternity.
quote67.author: Henry David Thoreau

quote68.quote: You cannot kill time without injuring eternity.
quote68.author: Henry David Thoreau

quote69.quote: Is what I'm doing or about to do getting us closer to our objective?
quote69.author: Robert Townsend

quote70.quote: Time makes heroes but dissolves celebrities.
quote70.author: Daniel J. Boorstin

quote71.quote: Time is the substance from which I am made. Time is a river which carries me along, but I am the river; it is a tiger that devours me, but I am the tiger; it is a fire that consumes me, but I am the fire.
quote71.author: Jorge Luis Borges

quote72.quote: A watch can only tell us how much time it is, how much time has passed, or how much time must still pass before something will occur. These statements are related not to time itself but only to its measurement or calculation.
quote72.author: Medard Boss

quote73.quote: Time is the one thing we possess. Our success depends upon the use of our time, and its by-product, the odd moment.
quote73.author: Arthur Brisbane

quote74.quote: I am ready any time. Do not keep me waiting.
quote74.author: John Mason Brown

quote75.quote: Time has no meaning in itself unless we choose to give it significance.
quote75.author: Leo Buscaglia

quote76.quote: You must never find time for anything. If you want time you must make it.
quote76.author: Charles Buxton

quote77.quote: Oh Time! the beautifier of the dead, adorer of the ruin, comforter and only healer when the heart hath bled... Time, the avenger!
quote77.author: Lord (George Gordon) Byron

quote78.quote: If time is precious, no book that will not improve by repeated reading deserves to be read at all.
quote78.author: Thomas Carlyle

quote79.quote: The illuminable, silent, never-resting thing called Time, rolling, rushing on, swift, silent, like an all-embracing oceantide, on which we and all the universe swim like exhalations, like apparitions which are, and then are not: this is forever very literally a miracle; a thing to strike us dumb, for we have no word to speak about it.
quote79.author: Thomas CarlyleOn Heroes, Hero-Worship, and the Heroic in History, 1841

quote80.quote: There is time for work. And time for love. That leaves no other time.
quote80.author: Coco Chanel

quote81.quote: Time and tide wait for no man.
quote81.author: Chaucer

quote82.quote: The less one has to do, the less time one finds to do it in.
quote82.author: Lord Chesterfield

quote83.quote: Take care in your minutes, and the hours will take care of themselves.
quote83.author: Lord Chesterfield

quote84.quote: I recommend you to take care of the minutes, for the hours will take care of themselves.
quote84.author: Lord Chesterfield

quote85.quote: If we open a quarrel between the past and the present, we shall find we have lost the future.
quote85.author: Sir Winston Churchill

quote86.quote: Time destroys the speculation of men, but it confirms nature.
quote86.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote87.quote: Much may be done in those little shreds and patches of time, which every day produces, and which most men throw away, but which nevertheless will make at the end of it no small deduction for the life of man.
quote87.author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote88.quote: Time; that black and narrow isthmus between two eternities.
quote88.author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote89.quote: Time is the most undefinable yet paradoxical of things; the past is gone, the future is not come, and the present becomes the past even while we attempt to define it, and, like the flash of lightning, at once exists and expires.
quote89.author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote90.quote: We simply assume that the way we see things is the way they really are or the way they should be. And our attitudes and behaviors grow out of these assumptions.
quote90.author: Stephen Covey

quote91.quote: Management works in the system; Leadership works on the system.
quote91.author: Stephen Covey

quote92.quote: Nothing is to come, and nothing past: But an eternal now, does always last.
quote92.author: Abraham Cowley

quote93.quote: Time is money, especially when you are talking to a lawyer or buying a commercial.
quote93.author: Frank Dane

quote94.quote: A man who dares to waste one hour of his life has not discovered the value of life.
quote94.author: Charles Darwin

quote95.quote: One thing you can't recycle is wasted time.
quote95.author: Anon.

quote96.quote: Monday is the key day of the week.
quote96.author: Scottish Proverb

quote97.quote: An inch of time cannot be bought with an inch of gold.
quote97.author: Chinese Proverb

quote98.quote: There is but an hour a day between a good housewife and a bad one.
quote98.author: English Proverb

quote99.quote: Time is the soul of business.
quote99.author: English Proverb

quote100.quote: With time and patience the mulberry leaf becomes a silk gown.
quote100.author: Chinese Proverb

quote101.quote: Time goes by so fast, people go in and out of your life. You must never miss the opportunity to tell these people how much they mean to you.no source for this, even a website dedicated to Cheers doesn't have it http://www.tvtome.com/tvtome/servlet/GuidePageServlet/showid-66/epid-14345/
quote101.author: Anon.attributed to Cheers

quote102.quote: Everything passes, everything perishes, everything palls.
quote102.author: Proverb

quote103.quote: Life is half spent before one knows what it is.
quote103.author: Proverb

quote104.quote: Love makes time pass away and time makes love pass away.
quote104.author: Proverb

quote105.quote: Why kill time when one can employ it.
quote105.author: Proverb

quote107.quote: The morning hour has gold in its mouth.
quote107.author: Proverb

quote108.quote: Even a clock that is not going is right twice a day.
quote108.author: Proverb

quote109.quote: Time and I against any two.
quote109.author: Proverb

quote110.quote: The longest day soon comes to an end.
quote110.author: Proverb

quote112.quote: Now is the watchword of the wise.
quote112.author: Proverb

quote113.quote: Lost time is never found again.
quote113.author: Proverb

quote114.quote: We are preoccupied with time. If we could learn to love space as deeply as we are now obsessed with time, we might discover a new meaning in the phrase to live like men.
quote114.author: Edward AbbeyDesert Solitaire

quote115.quote: It is all very beautiful and magical here - a quality which cannot be described. You have to live it and breathe it, let the sun bake into you. The skies and the lands are so enormous, and the detail so precise and exquisite that wherever you are you are isolated into a glowing world between the macro and the micro, where everything is sidewise under you and over you, and the clocks stopped long ago.
quote115.author: Ansel Adamsfrom A Letter to Alfred Stieglitz from Abiquiu, New Mexico., September 21, 1937

quote117.quote: I cannot afford to waste my time making money.
quote117.author: Louis Agassiz

quote118.quote: Since time is the one immaterial object which we cannot influence -- neither speed up nor slow down, add to nor diminish -- it is an imponderably valuable gift.
quote118.author: Maya Angelou

quote119.quote: He who lets time rule him will live the life of a slave.
quote119.author: John Arthorne

quote120.quote: Time is the wisest of all counselors.
quote120.author: Plutarch

quote121.quote: One by one the sands are flowing, One by one the moments fall;Some are coming, some are going;Do not strive to grasp them all.
quote121.author: Adelaide Proctor

quote122.quote: You can't turn back the clock. But you can wind it up again.
quote122.author: Bonnie Prudden

quote123.quote: One of the greatest resources people cannot mobilize themselves is that they try to accomplish great things. Most worthwhile achievements are the result of many little things done in a single direction.
quote123.author: Nido Qubein

quote124.quote: Time is the fairest and toughest judge.
quote124.author: Edgar Quinet

quote125.quote: The shortest period of time lies between the minute you put some money away for a rainy day and the unexpected arrival of rain.
quote125.author: Jane Bryant Quinn

quote126.quote: Time is at once the most valuable and the most perishable of all our possessions.
quote126.author: John Randolph

quote127.quote: Don't be fooled by the calendar. There are only as many days in the year as you make use of. One man gets only a week's value out of a year while another man gets a full year's value out of a week.
quote127.author: Charles Richards

quote128.quote: There is here no measuring with time, no year matters, and ten years are nothing. Being an artist means, not reckoning and counting, but ripening like the tree which does not force it's sap and stands confident in the storms of Spring without the fear that after them may come no Summer. It does come. I learn it daily, learn it with pain to which I am grateful
quote128.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote129.quote: Once you have mastered time, you will understand how true it is that most people overestimate what they can accomplish in a year -- and underestimate what they can achieve in a decade!
quote129.author: Anthony Robbins

quote130.quote: Nothing is a waste of time if you use the experience wisely.
quote130.author: Auguste Rodin

quote131.quote: Half our life is spent trying to find something to do with the time we have rushed through life trying to save.
quote131.author: Will Rogers

quote132.quote: Time is more value than money. You can get more money, but you cannot get more time.
quote132.author: Jim Rohn

quote133.quote: never before have we had so little time in which to do so much.
quote133.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote134.quote: American time has stretched around the world. It has become the dominant tempo of modern history, especially of the history of Europe.
quote134.author: Harold Rosenberg

quote135.quote: The Eternal looked upon me for a moment with His eye of power, and annihilated me in His being, and become manifest to me in His essence. I saw I existed through Him.
quote135.author: Rumi

quote136.quote: The time you enjoy wasting is not wasted time.
quote136.author: Bertrand Russell

quote137.quote: A truer image of the world, I think, is obtained by picturing things as entering into the stream of time from an eternal world outside, than from a view which regards time as the devouring tyrant of all that is.
quote137.author: Bertrand Russell

quote138.quote: Imagine that I am riding a bicycle toward you. As I approach an intersection I nearly collide, so it seems to me, with a horsedrawn cart. I swerve and barely avoid being run over. Now think of the event again, and imagine that the cart and the bicycle are both traveling close to the speed of light. If you are standing down the road, the cart is traveling at right angles to your light of sight. You see me, by reflected sunlight, traveling toward you. Would not my speed be added to the speed of light so that my image would get to you considerably before the image of the cart? Should you not see me swerve before you see the cart arrive? Can the cart and I approach the intersection simultaneously from my point of view, but not from yours? Could I experience a near collision with the cart while you perhaps see me swerve around nothing and pedal cheerfully on toward the town of Vinci? These are curious and subtle questions. They challenge the obvious. There is a reason that no one thought of them before Einstein. From such elementary questions, Einstein produced a fundamental rethinking of the world, a revolution in physics.
quote138.author: Carl SaganCosmos. (New York: Ballantine, 1980), 166-167.

quote139.quote: Time is the coin of your life. It is the only coin you have, and only you can determine how it will be spent. Be careful lest you let other people spend it for you.
quote139.author: Carl Sandburg

quote140.quote: Time has a wonderful way of weeding out the trivial.
quote140.author: Richard Ben Sapir

quote141.quote: Three o clock is always too late or too early for anything you want to do.
quote141.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote142.quote: Think with awe on the slow and quiet power of time.
quote142.author: Friedrich von Schiller

quote143.quote: Time is that in which all things pass away.
quote143.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote145.quote: No one can be right all of the time, but it helps to be right most of the time.
quote145.author: Robert Half

quote146.quote: Time spent on hiring is time well spent.
quote146.author: Robert Half

quote147.quote: Misspending a man's time is a kind of self-homicide.
quote147.author: Edward F. Halifax

quote148.quote: Time is a great healer, but a poor beautician.
quote148.author: Lucille S. Harper

quote149.quote: This required abandoning the idea that there is a universal quantity called time that all clocks measure. Instead, everyone would have his own personal time. The clocks of two people would agree if they were at rest with respect to each other but not if they were moving. This has been confirmed by a number of experiments, including one in which an extremely accurate timepiece was flown around the world and then compared with one that had stayed in place. If you wanted to live longer, you could keep flying to the east so the speed of the plane added to the earth
quote149.author: Stephen Hawking

quote150.quote: Time is the rider that breaks youth.
quote150.author: George Herbert

quote151.quote: City people try to buy time as a rule, when they can, whereas country people are prepared to kill time, although both try to cherish in their mind's eye the notion of a better life ahead.
quote151.author: Edward Hoagland

quote152.quote: Time, you old gypsy man, will you not stay, put up your caravan just for one day?
quote152.author: Ralph Hodgson

quote153.quote: Make a good use of the present.
quote153.author: Horace

quote154.quote: When men are not regretting that life is so short, they are doing something to kill time.
quote154.author: Edward W. Howe

quote155.quote: What a folly it is to dread the thought of throwing away life at once, and yet have no regard to throwing it away by parcels and piecemeal.
quote155.author: John Howe

quote156.quote: He who every morning plans the transaction of the day and follows out the plan, carries a thread that will guide him through the labyrinth of the most busy life.
quote156.author: Victor Hugo

quote157.quote: We realize our dilemma goes deeper than shortage of time; it is basically a problem of priorities. We confess, We have left undone those things that ought to have done; and we have done those things which we ought not to have done.
quote157.author: Charles E. Hummel

quote158.quote: Time, whose tooth gnaws away at everything else, is powerless against truth.
quote158.author: Thomas Henry Huxley

quote159.quote: If you want to make good use of your time, you've got to know what's most important and then give it all you've got.
quote159.author: Lee Iacocca

quote160.quote: Heck by the time a man scratches his behind, clears his throat, and tells me how smart he is, we've already wasted fifteen minutes.
quote160.author: Lyndon B. Johnson

quote161.quote: O, for an engine, to keep back all clocks, or make the sun forget his motion!
quote161.author: Ben Jonson

quote162.quote: Time is a gift, given to you, given to give you the time you need, the time you need to have the time of your life.
quote162.author: Norton JusterThe Phantom Tollbooth

quote163.quote: The idea is to make decisions and act on them -- to decide what is important to accomplish, to decide how something can best be accomplished, to find time to work at it and to get it done.
quote163.author: Karen Kakascik

quote164.quote: We must use time as a tool, not as a couch.
quote164.author: John Fitzgerald Kennedy

quote165.quote: I have lots of things to teach you now, in case we ever meet, concerning the message that was transmitted to me under a pine tree in North Carolina on a cold winter moonlit night. It said that Nothing Ever Happened, so don't worry. It's all like a dream. Everything is ecstasy, inside. We just don't know it because of our thinking-minds. But in our true blissful essence of mind is known that everything is alright forever and forever and forever. Close your eyes, let your hands and nerve-ends drop, stop breathing for 3 seconds, listen to the silence inside the illusion of the world, and you will remember the lesson you forgot, which was taught in immense milky way soft cloud innumerable worlds long ago and not even at all. It is all one vast awakened thing. I call it the golden eternity. It is perfect. We were never really born, we will never really die. It has nothing to do with the imaginary idea of a personal self, other selves, many selves everywhere: Self is only an idea, a mortal idea. That which passes into everything is one thing. It's a dream already ended. There's nothing to be afraid of and nothing to be glad about. I know this from staring at mountains months on end. They never show any expression, they are like empty space. Do you think the emptiness of space will ever crumble away? Mountains will crumble, but the emptiness of space, which is the one universal essence of mind, the vast awakenerhood, empty and awake, will never crumble away because it was never born.
quote165.author: Jack Kerouac

quote166.quote: We must use time creatively -- and forever realize that the time is always hope to do great things.
quote166.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote167.quote: Time makes friendship stronger, but love weaker
quote167.author: Jean De La Bruyere

quote168.quote: Time = Life, Therefore, waste your time and waste of your life, or master your time and master your life.
quote168.author: Alan Lakein

quote169.quote: Review our priorities, ask the question; What's the best use of our time right now?
quote169.author: Alan Lakein

quote170.quote: Your greatest asset is your earning ability. Your greatest resource is your time.
quote170.author: Brian Tracy

quote171.quote: When as a child I laughed and wept, time crept. When as a youth I waxed more bold, time strolled. When I became a full-grown man, time RAN. When older still I daily grew, time FLEW. Soon I shall find, in passing on, time gone. O Christ! wilt Thou have saved me then? Amen.
quote171.author: Henry Twells

quote172.quote: If there is a symbol of our age, perhaps it is something that every factory worker does each day of their working lives -- I refer to clocking in. (Very soon probably they won't even have to do that; the clock will itself observe them by radar.) In the ancient world when a person entered a temple, each made a votive offering to a god or a goddess at the door. As twentieth century people file into their shrines, they obediently pay their due to the god that regulates their lives -- the clock. It is the clock that measures us, that silent witness that keeps our going in and our coming out and relentlessly records our every movement. That is where all our organization and machinery to free us from time, to save us time, has brought us. Never before have we had such control over things, and never before have we been so enslaved by them. And of nothing is this more true than of time.
quote172.author: Evelyn UnderhillThe Mastery of Time

quote173.quote: Everything in this life takes longer than you think except life itself.
quote173.author: Source Unknown

quote174.quote: He that lacks the time to mourn, lacks time to mend.
quote174.author: Source Unknown

quote175.quote: An alarm clock is a device that makes you rise and whine.
quote175.author: Source Unknown

quote176.quote: I am what you will be, I was what you are.
quote176.author: Source Unknown

quote177.quote: The infinite is in the finite of every instant.
quote177.author: Source Unknown

quote178.quote: Every morning you are handed 24 golden hours. They are one of the few things in this world that you get free of charge. If you had all the money in the world, you couldn't buy an extra hour. What will you do with this priceless treasure? Remember, you must
quote178.author: Source Unknown

quote179.quote: One thing you can't recycle is wasted time
quote179.author: Source Unknown

quote180.quote: Priority: A statement of the importance of a user or a program. Often expressed as a relative priority, indicating that the user doesn't care when the work is completed so long as he is treated less badly than someone else.
quote180.author: Source Unknown

quote181.quote: Get into the habit of asking yourself if what you are doing can be handled by someone else.
quote181.author: Source Unknown

quote182.quote: A person who borrows your watch, tells you what time it is, pockets your watch, and then sends you a bill for it.
quote182.author: Source Unknown

quote183.quote: A man's main job is to become supremely aware of and intimately involved in the great issues of his time
quote183.author: Source Unknown

quote184.quote: To save time is to lengthen life.
quote184.author: Source Unknown

quote185.quote: You love what you find time to do.
quote185.author: Source Unknown

quote186.quote: What comes first, the compass or the clock? Before one can truly manage time (the clock), it is important to know where you are going, what your priorities and goals are, in which direction you are headed (the compass). Where you are headed is more important than how fast you are going. Rather than always focusing on what's urgent, learn to focus on what is really important.
quote186.author: Source Unknown

quote187.quote: Time spent in getting even would be better spent in getting ahead.
quote187.author: Source Unknown

quote188.quote: Time is nature's way of making sure that everything doesn't happen at once.
quote188.author: Source Unknown

quote189.quote: Time invested in improving ourselves cuts down on time wasted in disapproving of others.
quote189.author: Source Unknown

quote190.quote: Time cuts down all, both great and small.
quote190.author: Source Unknown

quote191.quote: The woman who says she won't be a minute is usually right.
quote191.author: Source Unknown

quote192.quote: To get all there is out of living, we must employ our time wisely, never being in too much of a hurry to stop and sip life, but never losing our sense of the enormous value of a minute.
quote192.author: Robert Updegraff

quote193.quote: The trouble with our times is that the future is not what it used to be.
quote193.author: Paul Ambroise Valery

quote194.quote: Time is too slow for those who waittoo swift for those who feartoo long for those who grieve,too short for those who rejoice,but for those who love, time is eternity.Hours fly, flowers die, new days, new ways pass by, Love stays.
quote194.author: Henry Van DykeKatrina's Sun Dial

quote195.quote: Time stays long enough for those who use it.
quote195.author: Leonardo DaVinci

quote196.quote: A day wasted on others is not wasted on one's self.
quote196.author: Charles Dickens

quote197.quote: Time is the most valuable thing a man can spend.
quote197.author: Diogenes

quote198.quote: Time goes, you say? Ah, no! Alas, Time stays, we go.
quote198.author: Austin Dobson

quote199.quote: One can always trust to time. Insert a wedge of time and nearly everything straightens itself out.
quote199.author: Norman Douglas

quote200.quote: Time is the scarcest resource of the manager; If it is not managed, nothing else can be managed
quote200.author: Peter Drucker

quote201.quote: Everything requires time. It is the only truly universal condition. All work takes place in time and uses up time. Yet most people take for granted this unique, irreplaceable, and necessary resource. Nothing else, perhaps, distinguishes effective executives as much as their tender loving care of time.
quote201.author: Peter Drucker

quote202.quote: Until we can manage TIME, we can manage nothing else.
quote202.author: Peter Drucker

quote203.quote: One cannot buy, rent or hire more time. The supply of time is totally inelastic. No matter how high the demand, the supply will not go up. There is no price for it. Time is totally perishable and cannot be stored. Yesterday's time is gone forever, and will never come back. Time is always in short supply. There is no substitute for time. Everything requires time. All work takes place in, and uses up time. Yet most people take for granted this unique, irreplaceable and necessary resource.
quote203.author: Peter Drucker

quote204.quote: Time is the most valuable coin in your life. You and you alone will determine how that coin will be spent. Be careful that you don't let other people spend it for you.
quote204.author: John Dryden

quote205.quote: The best way to fill time is to waste it.
quote205.author: Marguerite Duras

quote206.quote: Time is what keeps the light from reaching us. There is no greater obstacle to God than time: and not only time but temporalities, not only temporal things but temporal affections, not only temporal affections but the very taint and smell of time.
quote206.author: Meister Eckhart

quote207.quote: If an army of monkeys were strumming on typewriters, they might write all the books in the British Museum.
quote207.author: Sir Arthur Eddington, "In the Nature of the Physical World", 1928

quote208.quote: When a man sits with a pretty girl for an hour, it seems like a minute. But let him sit on a hot stove for a minute -- then it's longer than any hour. That's relativity!
quote208.author: Albert Einstein

quote209.quote: All my possessions for a moment of time.
quote209.author: Queen Elizabeth

quote210.quote: One of the illusions of life is that the present hour is not the critical, decisive hour. Write it on your heart that every day is the best day in the year. No man has learned anything rightly, until he knows that every day is Doomsday.
quote210.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote211.quote: This time, like all times, is a very good one, if we but know what to do with it.
quote211.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote212.quote: These times of ours are serious and full of calamity, but all times are essentially alike. As soon as there is life there is danger.
quote212.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote214.quote: So much of our time is spent in preparation, so much in routine, and so much in retrospect, that the amount of each person's genius is confined to a very few hours.
quote214.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote215.quote: The roses under my window make no reference to former roses or better ones; they are what they are; they exist with God today. There is no time to them. There is simply the rose; it is perfect in every moment of its existence.
quote215.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote216.quote: What do you want to get done? In what order of importance? Over what period of time? What is the time available? What is the best strategy for application of time to projects for the most effective results?
quote216.author: Ted W. Engstrom

quote217.quote: Anything that is wasted effort represents wasted time. The best management of our time thus becomes linked inseparably with the best utilization of our efforts.
quote217.author: Ted W. Engstrom

quote218.quote: Time will explain it all. He is a talker, and needs no questioning before he speaks.
quote218.author: Euripides

quote219.author: William FaulknerThe Sound and the Fury

quote220.quote: In all planing you make a list and you set priorities.
quote220.author: Alan Lakein

quote221.quote: Be intent on the perfection of the present day.
quote221.author: William Law

quote222.quote: Write down the most important things you have to do tomorrow. Now, number them in the order of their true importance. The first thing tomorrow morning, start working on an item Number 1, and stay with it until completed. Then take item Number 2 the same way. Then Number 3, and so on. Don't worry if you don't complete everything on the schedule. At least you will have completed the most important projects before getting to the less important ones.
quote222.author: Ivy Lee

quote223.quote: We all run on two clocks. One is the outside clock, which ticks away our decades and brings us ceaselessly to the dry season. The other is the inside clock, where you are your own timekeeper and determine your own chronology, your own internal weather and your own rate of living. Sometimes the inner clock runs itself out long before the outer one, and you see a dead man going through the motions of living.
quote223.author: Max Lerner

quote224.quote: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
quote224.author: Samuel Levenson

quote225.quote: All that is not eternal is eternally out of date.
quote225.author: C.S. Lewis

quote226.quote: People who never have any time on their hands are those who do the least.
quote226.author: G. C. (Georg Christoph) Lichtenberg

quote227.quote: There is a place where time stands still....illuminated by only the most feeble red light, for light is diminished to almost nothing at the center of time, its vibrations slowed to echoes in vast canyons, its intensity reduced to the faint glow of fireflies.
quote227.author: Alan LightmanEinstein's Dreams

quote228.quote: Nothing valuable can be lost by taking time.
quote228.author: Abraham Lincoln

quote229.quote: One realizes the full importance of time only when there is little of it left. Every man's greatest capital asset is his unexpired years of productive life.
quote229.author: P. W. Litchfield

quote230.quote: How many times have you heard this statement, I haven't time. How many times have we made it ourselves? oh, I wish I had time. Time for what? Time to work in the Church, to serve in our communities and time to improve our minds. Think again of these twenty-four hours that are given to us.
quote230.author: John Longden

quote231.quote: Look not mournfully into the Past. It comes not back again. Wisely improve the Present. In is thine. Go forth to meet the shadowy Future, without fear, and a manly heart.
quote231.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote232.quote: Time! Joyless emblem of the greed of millions, robber of the best which earth can give.
quote232.author: Amy Lowell

quote233.quote: In truth, people can generally make time for what they choose to do; it is not really the time but the will that is lacking.
quote233.author: Sir John Lubbock

quote234.quote: Our Lord has written the promise of resurrection, not in books alone, but in every leaf in springtime.
quote234.author: Martin Luther

quote235.quote: Two golden hours somewhere between sunrise and sunset. Both are set with 60 diamond minutes. No reward is offered. They are gone forever.
quote235.author: Horace Mann

quote236.quote: Lost, yesterday, somewhere between sunrise and sunset, two golden hours, each set with sixty diamond minutes. No reward is offered for they are gone forever.
quote236.author: Horace Mann

quote237.quote: Time has no division to mark its passage, there is never a thunderstorm or blare of trumpets to announce the beginning of a new month or year. Even when a new century begins it is only we mortals who ring bells and fire pistols.
quote237.author: Thomas MannThe Magic Mountain

quote238.quote: Hold fast the time! Guard it, watch over it, every hour, every minute! Unregarded it slips away, like a lizard, smooth, slippery, faithless, a pixy wife. Hold every moment sacred. Give each clarity and meaning, each the weight of thine awareness, each its true and due fulfillment.
quote238.author: Thomas MannThe Beloved Returns, 1939

quote239.quote: It's how we spend our time here and now, that really matters. If you are fed up with the way you have come to interact with time, change it.
quote239.author: Wieder Marcia

quote240.quote: When we are doing what we love, we don't care about time. For at least at that moment, time doesn't exist and we are truly free.
quote240.author: Wieder Marcia

quote241.quote: But at my back I always hear time's winged chariot hurrying near.
quote241.author: Andrew Marvell

quote242.quote: No man goes before his time -- unless the boss leaves early.
quote242.author: Groucho Marx

quote243.quote: Time flies like an arrow, fruit flies like a banana.
quote243.author: Groucho Marx

quote244.quote: We should not say that one man's hour is worth another man's hour, but rather that one man during an hour is worth just as much as another man during an hour. Time is everything, man is nothing: he is at the most time's carcass.
quote244.author: Karl Marx

quote245.quote: If you haven't got the time to do it right, when will you find the time to do it over?
quote245.author: Jeffery J. Mayer

quote246.quote: While time, the endless idiot, runs screaming round the world.
quote246.author: Carson Mccullers

quote247.quote: Set priorities for your goals. A major part of successful living lies in the ability to put first things first. Indeed, the reason most major goals are not achieved is that we spend our time doing second things first.
quote247.author: Robert J. Mckain

quote248.quote: For tribal man space was the uncontrollable mystery. For technological man it is time that occupies the same role.
quote248.author: Marshall McLuhan

quote249.quote: I must govern the clock, not be governed by it.
quote249.author: Golda Meir

quote251.quote: I learned that we can do anything, but we can't do everything... at least not at the same time. So think of your priorities not in terms of what activities you do, but when you do them. Timing is everything.
quote251.author: Dan Millman

quote252.quote: I learned that we can do anything, but we can't do everything... at least not at the same time. So think of your priorities not in terms of what activities you do, but when you do them. Timing is everything.
quote252.author: Dan Millman

quote253.quote: Success in the majority of circumstances depends on knowing how long it takes to succeed.
quote253.author: Charles Montesquieu

quote254.quote: The secret of your future is hidden in your daily routine.
quote254.author: Mike Murdock

quote255.quote: Time is not measured by the passing of years, but by what one does, what one feels and what one achieves.
quote255.author: Jawaharlal Nehru

quote256.quote: When one has much to put into them, a day has a hundred pockets.
quote256.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote257.quote: Time flies. It's up to you to be the navigator.
quote257.author: Robert Orben

quote258.quote: Clocks will go as they are set, but man, irregular man, is never constant, never certain.
quote258.author: Thomas Otway

quote259.quote: Time glides away and as we get older through the noiseless years; the days flee and are restrained by no reign.
quote259.author: Ovid

quote260.quote: Neither can the wave that has passed by be recalled, nor the hour which has passed return again.
quote260.author: Ovid

quote261.quote: Nothing is swifter than our years.
quote261.author: Ovid

quote262.quote: Time is the devourer of all things.
quote262.author: Ovid

quote263.quote: We think very little of time present; we anticipate the future, as being too slow, and with a view to hasten it onward, we recall the past to stay it as too swiftly gone. We are so thoughtless, that we thus wander through the hours which are not here, regardless only of the moment that is actually our own.
quote263.author: Blaise Pascal

quote264.quote: We are condemned to kill time, thus we die bit by bit.
quote264.author: Octavio Paz

quote265.quote: Until you value yourself, you won't value your time. Until you value your time, you will not do anything with it. Or something. I dunno, I was only half listening. Becca said it, anyway. Ask her.http://www.beliefnet.com/story/159/story_15928_1.html
quote265.author: M Scott Peck

quote266.quote: Wait for the wisest of all counselors, Time.
quote266.author: Pericles

quote267.quote: Time is the king of all men, he is their parent and their grave, and gives them what he will and not what they crave.
quote267.author: Pericles

quote268.quote: Well arranged time is the surest mark of a well arranged mind.
quote268.author: Pitman

quote269.quote: They are all parts of time, and the past and future are created species of time, which we unconsciously but wrongly transfer to the eternal essence; for we say that he was, he is, he will be, but the truth is that is alone is properly attributed to him, and that was and will be only to be spoken of becoming in time, for they are motions, but that which is immovably the same cannot become older or younger by time, nor ever did or has become, or hereafter will be, older or younger, nor is subject at all to any of those states which affect moving and sensible things and of which generation is the cause. These are the forms of time, which imitates eternity and revolves according to a law of number. Moreover, when we say that what has become is become and what becomes is becoming, and that what will become is about to become and that the non-existent is non-existent-all these are inaccurate modes of expression...
quote269.author: PlatoTimaeus (Translated by Benjamin Jowett), 360

quote270.quote: The great dividing line between success and failure can be expressed in five words: I DID NOT HAVE TIME.
quote270.author: Franklin Field

quote271.quote: I shall not waste my days in trying to prolong them. I shall use my time.
quote271.author: Ian Fleming

quote273.quote: It has been my observation that most people get ahead during the time that others waste.
quote273.author: Henry Ford

quote274.quote: Since thou are not sure of a minute, throw not away an hour.
quote274.author: Benjamin Franklin

quote275.quote: If time be of all things the most precious, wasting time must be the greatest prodigality.
quote275.author: Benjamin Franklin

quote276.quote: Dost thou love life? Then do not squander time, for that is the stuff life is made of.
quote276.author: Benjamin Franklin

quote277.quote: Do not squander time for that is the stuff life is made of.
quote277.author: Benjamin Franklin

quote278.quote: He that rises late must trot all day.
quote278.author: Benjamin Franklin

quote279.quote: You may delay, but time will not.
quote279.author: Benjamin Franklin

quote280.quote: Modern man thinks he loses something - time - when he does not do things quickly. Yet he does not know what to do with the time he gains -- except kill it.
quote280.author: Erich Fromm

quote281.quote: Time and tide wait for no man, but time always stands still for a woman of 30.
quote281.author: Robert Frost

quote282.quote: Nature's first green is gold, Her hardest hue to hold.Her early leaf's a flowerBut only so an hour.Then leaf subsides to leaf.So Eden sank to grief,So dawn goes down to day.Nothing Gold can stay.
quote282.author: Robert Frost

quote283.quote: The biggest difference between time and space is that you can't reuse time.
quote283.author: Merrick Furst

quote284.quote: Life is hardly more than a fraction of a second. Such a little time to prepare oneself for eternity!
quote284.author: Paul Gauguin

quote285.quote: Management manages by making decisions and by seeing that those decisions are implemented.
quote285.author: Harold S. Geneen

quote286.quote: Time has been transformed, and we have changed; it has advanced and set us in motion; it has unveiled its face, inspiring us with bewilderment and exhilaration.
quote286.author: Kahlil Gibran, "Children of Gods, Scions of Apes"

quote287.quote: Time is money says the proverb, but turn it around and you get a precious truth. Money is time.
quote287.author: George Robert Gissing

quote288.quote: Believe me when I tell you that thrift of time will repay you in after life, with a usury of profit beyond your most sanguine dreams; and that waste of it will make you dwindle, alike in intellectual and moral stature, beyond your darkest reckoning.
quote288.author: William Ewart GladstoneThe Life of William Ewart Gladstone by John Morley

quote289.quote: Every situation, every moment -- is of infinite worth; for it is the representative of a whole eternity.
quote289.author: Johann von Goethe

quote290.quote: Nothing is to be rated higher than the value of the day.
quote290.author: Johann von Goethe

quote291.quote: We always have time enough, if we will but use it aright.
quote291.author: Johann von Goethe

quote292.quote: One always has time enough, if one will apply it well.
quote292.author: Johann von Goethe

quote293.quote: All time management begins with planning.
quote293.author: Tom Greening

quote294.quote: Just as you would not permit a fellow employee to steal a piece of office equipment, you shouldn't let anyone walk away with the time of his fellow managers.
quote294.author: Andrew Grove
